intro: Galium sylvaticum var. longifolium, commonly known as the long-leaved woodcrushers, is a herbaceous perennial native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in early summer. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and have a distinct hairy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
